alert.note: Alert for Routt (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 13 at 6:24AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Colorado, including the following county, Routt, and the intersection of Dry Creek and Highway 40. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 622 AM MDT, local law enforcement reported snowmelt in the advisory area with flooding reported along Highway 40 near the intersection of Dry Creek. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hayden. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
